case_vignette:
A 55-year-old man presents to his primary care physician for fatigue. He states he has not felt like himself recently and had to take a few days off of work secondary to fatigue. He has lost 10 pounds over the past month. He drinks 4 drinks per day and smokes 1 pack of cigarettes per day, which he has done for the past 20 years. His temperature is 99.0°F (37.2°C), blood pressure is 128/65 mmHg, pulse is 100/min, respirations are 11/min, and oxygen saturation is 98% on room air. Laboratory values are ordered as seen below.

Hemoglobin: 9 g/dL
Hematocrit: 27%
Leukocyte count: 2,500/mm^3 with normal differential
Platelet count: 293,000/mm^3

A biopsy of the bone marrow is performed which demonstrates hypocellular and fibrotic bone marrow and a peripheral smear is performed as seen in Figure A.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Hematology and Oncology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been feeling really tired lately and even had to miss work because of it.
Have you noticed any other symptoms such as fever, weight loss, or difficulty breathing?
Yes, I've lost 10 pounds over the past month without trying.
Have you had any recent injuries or illnesses?
No, I haven't had any injuries or recent illnesses.
Have you had any family members with similar symptoms?
No, my family members haven't had similar symptoms.
Have you had any recent changes in your medication or diet?
No, there haven't been any changes in my medication or diet.
Have you had any recent travel history?
No, I haven't traveled recently.
Have you had any recent stressful events or changes in your lifestyle?
No, there haven't been any stressful events or changes in my lifestyle.
Have you had any recent blood tests or medical check-ups?
Yes, I recently had some blood tests done.
What were the results of your blood tests?
My blood tests showed that my hemoglobin was low, at 9 g/dL, my hematocrit was 27%, my white blood cell count was low at 2,500/mm^3, but my platelet count was normal.
Final Diagnosis: Anemia.

There have been no changes in medication or diet, no recent travel, and no stressful events or changes in lifestyle. The patient recently had some blood tests done, which showed low hemoglobin at 9 g/dL, a hematocrit of 27%, and a low white blood cell count at 2,500/mm^3, but with a normal platelet count.
trial_0.vignette_frq: The most likely diagnosis is aplastic anemia.
